`SequenceModule` is a service for manag: `SequenceModule`  is a service for managing dynamic sequences in the system using DynamoDB as the primary database.
Generate unique sequence numbers based o: Generate unique sequence numbers based on parameters such as sequence type, tenant, or date.
Automatically reset sequences based on c: Automatically reset sequences based on cycles like:
Format sequence numbers according to spe: Format sequence numbers according to specific system requirements (e.g., TODO-PERSONAL-72-001).
Ensure data consistency and integrity in: Ensure data consistency and integrity in multi-tenant systems.
The solution for customizing the behavio: The solution for customizing the behavior of the `SequenceModule` is to pass it an options `object` in the static `register()` method. The options object is only contain one property:
`enableController`: enable or disable de: `enableController`: enable or disable default sequence controller.
We will create a simple example demonstr: We will create a simple example demonstrating how to use the sequence module and customize authentication for the sequence controller.
Beside controller, we can directly use `: Beside controller, we can directly use `SequenceService` to generating sequence by injecting service.
Generates a new sequence based on the pa: Generates a new sequence based on the parameters provided in the GenerateFormattedSequenceDto object.
The data transfer object that customizes: The data transfer object that customizes the behavior of the sequence generation. Its properties include:
Description: Specifies the date for whic: Description: Specifies the date for which the sequence is generated.
Description: Determines the rotation typ: Description: Determines the rotation type for the sequence.
Description: Identifies the tenant and t: Description: Identifies the tenant and type code for the intended usage.
Description: Defines parameters to ident: Description: Defines parameters to identify the sequence.
The return value of this function has t: The return value of this function  has type of `SequenceEntity` as follows:
By default, the returned data includes t: By default, the returned data includes the formattedNo field with the format `%%no%%`, where `no` represents the sequence number. If you want to define your own custom format, you can update the master data in DynamoDB with the following parameters:
The data structure should be as follows:: The data structure should be as follows:
For example, if you want to add `code1`: For example, if you want to add `code1` to `code5`,  `month`, `day `, `date`, `no` as well as `fiscal_year`, into your format, the format would look like this:
After the #, the length of the variable: After the #, the length of the variable is specified, indicating the desired length of the field when the formatted sequence number is returned.
`%%code2#:0>7%%` ensures code2 is format: `%%code2#:0>7%%` ensures code2 is formatted to be 7 characters long, padding with leading zeros if necessary.
`%%fiscal_year#:0>2%% `formats fiscal_ye: `%%fiscal_year#:0>2%% `formats fiscal_year to a length of 2 characters.
`%%code3%%` represents the code3 value a: `%%code3%%` represents the code3 value as it is.
`%%no#:0>3%%` ensures the sequence numbe: `%%no#:0>3%%` ensures the sequence number (no) is formatted to be 3 digits long, padded with leading zeros if necessary.
If you want to calculate the fiscal_year: If you want to calculate the fiscal_year starting from any specific month, you can add the `startMonth` field. For example, if you want the fiscal year to start from March, the format would look like this:
startMonth: Defines the month to start t: startMonth: Defines the month to start the fiscal year (e.g., 3 for March).
If you want to calculate the fiscal year: If you want to calculate the fiscal year starting from a specific date (e.x 2005-01-01), you can add the `registerDate` field, like this:
registerDate: Defines the exact start da: registerDate: Defines the exact start date of the fiscal year (e.g., "2005-01-01").
This allows you to customize the fiscal: This allows you to customize the fiscal year calculation according to your specific business needs.
This method allows you to generate a seq: This method allows you to generate a sequence with custom settings directly provided in the DTO, without requiring master data configuration in DynamoDB.
Use this method when you need dynamic se: Use this method when you need dynamic sequence settings that vary per request rather than fixed master data configuration.
